title: Rs 547 Crore 'Mule' Bank Account Fraud Busted In Telangana
content: Eighteen people were arrested in Telangana's Khammam district for operating "mule" bank accounts through which transactions amounting to Rs 547 crore linked to cyber fraud were routed, police said on Sunday.

content: India's trusted workhorse rocket, the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV), is poised for a dramatic comeback after last year's setback.

title: Help "Sedated, Tied Up" Puja Khedkar And Her Family, "Stole" Valuables In Pune

title: Woman Slapped, Abused By Man On Busy Andhra Road, None Came To Her Rescue
content: A woman in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam district took to social media on Sunday to describe an incident where she was slapped and abused by an unknown man while commuting to her workplace.

title: Adani Group To Invest Rs 1.5 Lakh Crore In Kutch Over 5 Years: Karan Adani

title: After Venezuela, Cuba next? Trump issues 'no more oil or money' ultimatum
content: US President Donald Trump has warned Cuba to strike a deal, stating that Venezuelan oil and money will cease flowing to Havana. He claimed that recent US actions have devastated Cuba's economy, leaving it with no income. Trump also hinted at potential political changes in Cuba, responding positively to a suggestion of Rubio leading the nation.

title: Controversy! Bangar calls Hindi ‚Äònational language of India‚Äô; faces backlash
content: Sanjay Bangar sparked controversy during the first IND vs NZ ODI by calling Hindi the ‚Äúnational language of India‚Äù on air. The remark, made during a discussion involving KL Rahul and Washington Sundar, drew heavy social media backlash, with fans pointing out that India has no national language. Meanwhile, New Zealand posted 300/8, led by Daryl Mitchell‚Äôs 84.

title: Microsoft AI CEO: We're building superintelligence backwards; need controls before trust
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges the industry to prioritize containment over alignment in AI development, warning against pursuing superintelligence without first ensuring control. He advocates for a "Humanist Superintelligence" approach, focusing on practical applications like medical AI and clean energy, to maintain human oversight and avoid uncontrolled autonomous systems.

title: ‚ÄòWhere has its nationalism gone?‚Äô: Owaisi attacks Centre over Chinese investments
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned the BJP government's nationalism, citing its invitation to Chinese companies despite security concerns and its silence on US President Donald Trump's alleged insults. Owaisi also criticized the Centre's asylum for Sheikh Hasina and the prolonged incarceration of Muslim youth without trial.

title: Phillips defies physics at point; Kohli can‚Äôt believe his eyes ‚Äî watch
content: The moment came in the eighth over of India‚Äôs innings. Gill, batting on eight, attempted a cut shot off the fourth ball of Zak Foulkes‚Äô over. The delivery was back of a length and outside the off stump. Gill stayed back and hit the ball hard towards the backward point region. Phillips moved quickly to his left, jumped and stretched out his left hand while airborne.

title: Big Short investor targets Oracle: Questions $95B debt for AI expansion; OpenAI deal at risk - 12
content: Investor Michael Burry, famous from 'The Big Short,' is betting against Oracle, citing concerns over its AI infrastructure expansion and significant debt.  He holds put options and has directly shorted the stock. Burry avoids shorting tech giants like Google and Microsoft, believing their core businesses offer stability despite AI investments.

title: ‚ÄòLegitimate targets‚Äô: Iran warns US of retaliation; Israel on alert ‚Äî will Trump order a strike?
content: Iran's leadership faces escalating protests, now in their third week, with over 116 reported deaths. Amidst this unrest, Israel is on high alert as US President Trump reportedly considers military action. Iran has issued a stern warning, deeming regional US bases and Israel as 'legitimate targets' if attacked.

title: Instagram reset email scare: 17.5M users affected; company issues clarification
content: Meta-owned Instagram has resolved an issue that sent out password reset emails. An external third party exploited a technical flaw, but Instagram's systems remain secure. Users can disregard these emails. This clarification follows reports of a data leak affecting millions of Instagram users. Security measures like two-factor authentication are recommended.

title: Chicago Bears hit by major playoff injury blow as TJ Edwards, Ozzy Trapilo ruled out
content: The Chicago Bears' Wild Card victory over the Packers was marred by season-ending injuries to linebacker T.J. Edwards (fractured fibula) and offensive tackle Ozzy Trapilo (patellar tendon). Both starters are out for the remainder of the postseason, forcing the Bears to rely on depth as they navigate the playoffs.

title: Bangladeshi umpire officiates IND vs NZ ODI amid Mustafizur row - who is he?
content: As per ICC regulations, umpires for ODIs are appointed under specific clauses. Clause 2.1.4 states that the ICC shall appoint one umpire for each ODI, who must not be from the same country as the participating teams and must be from the Elite Panel or International Panel. Clause 2.1.5 says the home board shall appoint one umpire.

title: No Rahul-Stalin in Tamil Nadu? DMK rejects Cong‚Äòs 'sharing power‚Äô proposal
content: Senior DMK leader I Periyasamy has firmly ruled out any coalition government in Tamil Nadu, stating chief minister M K Stalin is resolute against sharing power with allies, including the Congress. This assertion comes as the Tamil Nadu Congress renews its demand for a share in governance ahead of the upcoming assembly elections.

title: Iran president accuses US, Israel as protests turn violent; vows to listen to protesters
content: Iranian President Pezeshkian accused the US and Israel of orchestrating unrest, even as he acknowledged public grievances and warned against rioters. Protests, initially economic, have evolved into a challenge to the theocratic system, with rights groups reporting a rising death toll and detentions amid an internet blackout.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen‚Äôs family preferred Tom Brady over Joaquim Valente: Report
content: Gisele B√ºndchen‚Äôs family is reportedly uneasy about her marriage to Joaquim Valente, with Tom Brady still serving as a point of comparison. Sources claim relatives worry about financial imbalance and potential prenup loopholes, despite the couple‚Äôs happiness and growing family. While B√ºndchen appears confident in her choice, those closest to her remain cautious about long term security.

title: Watch: Fire breaks out in cinema hall in Odisha; major mishap averted
content: A minor fire broke out at Ashok Talkies in Rayagada during the screening of 'The Raja Saab', causing brief panic among moviegoers. The incident occurred when an aarti plate slipped and fell on papers near the screen, igniting them. Prompt action by staff and audience members quickly extinguished the flames, with no injuries or damage reported.

title: Tej Pratap renews Bharat Ratna push for Lalu; will invite CM Nitish for ‚Äòchoora-dahi bhoj‚Äô
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, chief of Janshakti Janta Dal, has once again demanded the Bharat Ratna for his father, former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav. He announced plans to formally write to the government, supporting his sister's recent social media remarks.

title: Drama at sacked IAS Puja Khedkar‚Äôs home: Family allegedly tied up, drugged & robbed ‚Äî how it unfolded
content: Pune police are investigating claims by former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar. She alleges a recently hired domestic help from Nepal drugged her and her parents, tied them up, and stole valuables and mobile phones from their Baner Road residence. Khedkar managed to free herself and alert authorities.

title: Iran unrest: France No. 1 Firouzja shares powerful message ‚Äî 'Live free or die'
content: French No. 1 chess grandmaster Alireza Firouzja drew global attention after posting ‚ÄúLong live Iran‚Äù on social media and sharing the monarchial-era Iranian flag. The post was linked to ongoing protests and a humanitarian crisis in Iran. Though now a French citizen, Firouzja‚Äôs message showed strong solidarity with Iranians and highlighted his deep emotional ties to his country of birth.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle confirms delay in Sports Club Atelier collection
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, shared an update on her upcoming collaboration with Hockey Canada, confirming a slight delay in the launch. She emphasized the importance of getting every detail right. The collection follows the success of her earlier releases, which blend hockey culture with luxury streetwear.

title: ‚ÄòJourney from 20% to 30% & 40% won‚Äôt be that long‚Äô: Shah says BJP vote share rising in Kerala
content: Union home minister Amit Shah expressed confidence in the BJP's growing support in Kerala, predicting a victory in the upcoming Assembly elections. He highlighted the party's increasing vote share and recent local body successes, attributing them to dedicated workers.

title: India talks diversity, but most companies employ less than 1% people with disabilities
content: India‚Äôs corporate diversity narrative falters when it comes to disability inclusion. Despite strong laws and public commitments, most companies employ fewer than 1 per cent persons with disabilities, according to the Marching Sheep PwD Inclusion Index 2025. The gap reflects systemic barriers, not lack of talent, locking millions of capable Indians out of formal employment.

title: ‚ÄòMisleading narrative‚Äô: Chirag jibes oppn over G RAM G protest, calls it ‚Äòhelp‚Äô in Bengal polls
content: Union minister Chirag Paswan accused the Congress and RJD of spreading a misleading narrative around government schemes like VB-G RAM G, claiming their protests would electorally benefit the NDA. Paswan defended the new scheme, emphasizing collective responsibility and improved focus on infrastructure projects, while criticizing the Congress for alleged corruption in MGNREGA.

title: Gateway to world: Kerala juice seller travels to 10 nations; China next on list
content: A humble sugarcane juice vendor from Kannur, Hashim VP, has turned his roadside stall into a launchpad for global exploration. For nearly three decades, his earnings have funded trips to ten countries, including Israel and Egypt. Now, the 67-year-old is preparing for his next adventure to China with his wife and brother, proving dreams can be realized through dedication.

title: BJP protest in Hyderabad: Man beaten for desecrating temple; arrested
content: A 26-year-old man from Karnataka was arrested in Hyderabad for allegedly entering a temple and committing indecent acts. Police registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita for unlawful entry and insulting religious beliefs. The incident sparked protests from Hindu groups, with the BJP president calling for strict action and accusing the ruling party of appeasement.

title: IND vs NZ: 'Where is Arshdeep?' ‚Äî Memes flood internet after pacer dropped
content: India faced New Zealand in the first ODI at Vadodara, but team selection stole the spotlight. Arshdeep Singh‚Äôs absence from the playing XI surprised fans and sparked memes online, with Mohammed Siraj returning instead. Meanwhile, Shreyas Iyer made his comeback after injury, strengthening India‚Äôs batting. Shubman Gill chose to bowl first, aiming to test combinations in helpful conditions.

title: Somaliland row: Somalia accuses Israel of planning Palestinian relocation; Tel Aviv denies
content: Somalia's defence minister claims Israel plans to move Palestinians to Somaliland. He calls this a violation of international law. Israel and Somaliland deny these allegations. Somalia's president previously stated Somaliland accepted Israeli conditions. The issue has drawn regional attention and condemnation from the OIC.

title: Nupur Sanon-Stebin Ben drop pics from their Christian wedding
content: In a picturesque celebration held in the enchanting city of Udaipur, Nupur Sanon, the sister of beloved actress Kriti Sanon, has officially embarked on her journey of love by marrying her longtime partner, Stebin Ben. The charming couple celebrated in a beautiful Christian wedding, donning elegant white ensembles that radiated joy.

title: ‚ÄòFrom Ghazni to Aurangzeb‚Äô: PM Modi invokes Somnath's history; hails temple‚Äôs resilience
content: Addressing a gathering during the Somnath Swabhiman Parv, PM Modi said: "Those present here, your ancestors, our ancestors, bet their lives for their faith, for their belief, for Mahadev - they sacrificed everything they had". Without taking names, PM Modi attacked the Congress-led government for "whitewashing the history" that encapsulates the multiple attacks by Mughal invaders on the Somnath temple.

title: MLB trade rumours: Pirates eye $66mn ex-Reds star to boost rotation
content: Pittsburgh Pirates are actively seeking a power boost for their lineup, eyeing free agent Eugenio Su√°rez.  The team, which struggled with home runs in 2025, sees Su√°rez as a direct solution.  A potential sign-and-trade with Seattle is also being explored, offering a win-win scenario for both clubs and Su√°rez himself.

title: Watch: NSUI protests against VB-GRAMG scheme in UP; security tightened in Varanasi, Lucknow
content: The National Students' Union of India (NSUI) protested the VB-GRAMG scheme across Uttar Pradesh, including Lucknow and Varanasi, on Sunday. Demonstrations in Lucknow saw workers detained by security. In Varanasi, heightened security surrounded Prime Minister Modi's public outreach office ahead of a planned "Save MGNREGA" march, with police and paramilitary forces on alert.

title: When disasters strike, preparation saves lives ‚Äî is India ready when crisis hits?
content: India faces escalating disaster risks due to geography, climate change, and development patterns, as starkly illustrated in 2025 by devastating floods and heatwaves. While response capacity has improved, a persistent imbalance favors reactive relief over proactive preparedness, a gap highlighted by contrasting events like Cyclone Phailin and Bihar's recurring floods.

title: Not Bumrah ‚Äî Sanjay Manjrekar names this bowler as 'find' of Indian cricket
content: Former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar lauded Harshit Rana as a significant find for India's bowling attack, highlighting his versatility across all game phases. Manjrekar noted Rana's effectiveness with the new ball and his T20 skills in later spells, bolstering India's middle-overs wicket-taking ability.

title: Mary Kom reveals why she divorced Onler Kom after over 20 yrs of marriage
content: Boxing legend MC Mary Kom reveals a devastating personal crisis following her divorce from husband Onler Kom. She faced financial ruin, property loss, and public slander, questioning her life's achievements. Despite betrayal, Mary is determined to focus on her children and rebuild her life, drawing strength from her family.

title: ‚ÄòIgnored signals, sudden U-turn, gunfight‚Äô: How cops nabbed Noida lift chain snatcher
content: A man accused of attempting to snatch a gold chain from a senior citizen in Greater Noida West was apprehended following a brief gunfight. The suspect, Rahul Yadav, was intercepted during a late-night vehicle check. He allegedly opened fire when signaled to stop, prompting police to return fire and injure him. A pistol and stolen motorcycle were recovered.

title: Aleppo clashes: Syrian govt takes control of Sheikh Maqsoud; detains 300 Kurds
content: Syrian government forces have taken full control of Aleppo after securing Sheikh Maqsoud, the city's last opposition-held district. This development followed intense fighting and the evacuation of hundreds of Kurdish fighters. The government also detained around 300 Kurds, including security personnel, as operations concluded.

title: A 72-hour workweek sounds heroic until you try it: This professional's story tells you why
content: Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy's call for a 72-hour workweek faced a viral rebuttal on Reddit. A professional's account of improved productivity and well-being after switching to a five-day week challenged the notion that longer hours equate to greater output. This highlights a generational divide in Indian work culture, questioning endurance over efficiency.

title: Another milestone! Virat Kohli goes past Sourav Ganguly
content: Virat Kohli has achieved another milestone, becoming the fifth Indian with the most ODI appearances, surpassing Sourav Ganguly.  With 309 matches played, he now trails only Tendulkar, Dhoni, Dravid, and Azharuddin.  Kohli is also nearing a significant batting record, poised to become the second-highest international run-scorer across all formats.

title: Actor-singer, Indian Idol Season 3 winner Prashant Tamang passes away at 43
content: Popular singer Prashant Tamang, winner of Indian Idol Season 3 and formerly associated with Kolkata Police, has passed away at 43. Hailing from the Darjeeling hills, Tamang was a nationally recognized artist, with West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressing deep sorrow over his untimely demise.

title: ‚ÄòA tubelight in his mind‚Äô: Owaisi hits back at Himanta over ‚Äòonly Hindu PM‚Äô remark
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi slammed Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's remark that only a Hindu can be PM, calling it a "Pakistan-like mindset." Owaisi asserted India's Constitution allows any citizen to hold the top post, envisioning a future hijab-clad PM. Political leaders across parties criticized Owaisi's comments, with some accusing him of appeasement.

title: MP: ‚ÄòGau mutra, gobar cancer project‚Äô funds splurged on cars, travel; probe unearths multi-crore scam
content: Instead of combating cancer with cow products, including milk, under the Panchgavya research project, the funds were allegedly splurged on cars, air travel and overpriced machines, an investigation has found. The probe was ordered by Jabalpur district collector Raghvendra Singh, who constituted a two-member committee led by additional collector R S Marawi, following complaints of misuse of the research funds.

title: 1st Isro launch of 2026 will put another ‚Äòeye in the sky‚Äô tomorrow
content: the rocket will launch an advanced earth observation satellite EOS-N1 (code-named 'Anvesha') it will also be carrying a european demonstrator satellite and 17 other satellites belonging to Indian and foreign agencies . it will help India secure its borders and be used in fields like agriculture, urban mapping and environmental observation .

title: Clock is ticking for Tottenham's Frank, with dwindling evidence he deserves extra time
content: 2-1 home defeat to aston villa ended their FA Cup campaign at the earliest possible opportunity . the previous Tottenham hotspur head coach survived last season by having a trophy to play for . however, he thinks his side should not get away with blaming injury .

title: Ja Morant trade guide: Four proposals for Memphis -- if it can find a suitor
content: sources tell ESPN's Shams Charania that a trade would end the franchise's tumultuous seven-year tenure in Memphis . the 26-year-old is averaging career lows in minutes, rebounds and 2- and 3-point percentages . he was suspended earlier this season for conduct detrimental to the team .

content: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari accuses the west Bengal police of attacking his convoy . the alleged attack happened in the presence of the police, but no FIR was registered . senior BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad recalled how a BJP delegation nearly failed to enter west Bengal‚Äôs Sandeshkhali .

title: What's next for Matt LaFleur, Brian Gutekunst after the Packers' wild-card loss?
content: the last time the Packers did anything with the contracts of coach Matt LaFleur and general manager Brian Gutekunst, it happened in relative secrecy . the news did not leak out until just before training camp in July that year . it was never clear why then-team president Mark Murphy tried to keep it a secret .

content: 136 teams hope to taste postseason glory . a champion will be crowned in a matchup . the team will face off at 7:30 p.m. ET on january 19 . it's the first time the team has won the title game in 2025 .

title: Inside the day the Ravens moved on from Harbaugh, and what's next for Baltimore
content: it seems no one inside the Baltimore Ravens ' training facility had conviction that Tuesday would become the most shocking day in franchise history . the belief inside the building was that the Ravens would undergo staff changes, perhaps at the coordinator positions, but that Harbaugh would remain the head coach in 2026 .
